title: Public transport for AUSX Open Supercross: Saturday 30 November 2024
articleContent:
World-renowned Supercross stars and Queensland brothers, Jett and Hunter Lawrence, are bringing back the AUSX Open to Melbourne's Marvel Stadium on November 30 after five years of international success in Europe and the USA. This one-night event promises to thrill Aussie fans with their Honda CRF450RWE bikes. Extra services will help you get to and from Marvel Stadium on Saturday 30 November 2024.

The gates open at 5.00pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. There are disruptions to the public transport and road network.

Click here for disruptions that may affect your journey.

Saturday 30 November 2024

In addition to our regular master timetable, we are also running the following extra services:

 Metropolitan train

To Marvel Stadium, via Southern Cross (forward):

  • Mernda departing at 4:29pm, arriving Southern Cross at 5:26pm
  • Greensborough departing at 4:36pm, arriving Southern Cross at 5:20pm
  • Craigieburn departing at 4:25pm, arriving Southern Cross at 5:03pm
  • Sandringham departing at 4:45pm, arriving Southern Cross at 5:22pm

From Marvel Stadium, via Southern Cross (return):

  • Mernda departing at 9:51pm and 10:21pm, Platform 9
  • Greensborough departing 10:00pm and 10:25pm, Platform 9
  • Frankston departing at 10:02pm, Platform 13
  • Moorabbin departing at 9:57pm and 10:22pm, Platform 13
  • Sandringham departing at 09:45pm and 10:06pm, Platform 13
  • Werribee departing at 09:45pm and 10:05pm, Platform 14
  • Craigieburn departing at 10:01pm and 10:13pm, Platform 11
  • Upfield departing at 09:57pm, Platform 11

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal timetable trains and consists will operate.

Return service from Southern Cross Station

Additional services

  • Train service from Southern Cross to Waurn Ponds (Geelong) leaving 10:10pm
  • Bus Banker from Southern Cross to Seymour leaving 10:00pm

Additional capacity

  • Southern Cross to Waurn Ponds (Geelong) leaving 09:55pm with additional seating.
  • Southern Cross to Wendouree (Ballarat) leaving 10:16pm with additional seating.
  • Southern Cross to Seymour leaving 11:45pm with additional seating.
  • Southern Cross to Bendigo (Bendigo) leaving 10:37pm with additional seating

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a and Route 86a between East Melbourne and Stop D1 Etihad Stadium via La Trobe Street.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium:

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Additional information 

  • Please check the disruptions page for any service changes that may affect your journey to and from the event.
  • To plan your route, please use our Journey planner.
  • Download the free and fully accessible PTV mobile app for Android and iOS and access public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • Passengers requiring accessibility information and assistance, see Accessible transport.
  • Passengers are advised to top up prior to travelling or to set auto top up so that you never need to top up again. For more information, see auto top up your myki.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google PayTM app.
  • For information on ticketing for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you have accessibility requirements, call us on 1800 800 007 before you travel.

Subscribe for weekly travel updates

Keep up to date with planned disruptions on your line/route and across the network by subscribing to our weekly travel update email.

Follow us on social media

For news, inspiration, hints and tips on Victoria’s public transport network, follow us on Facebook.

This one-night event promises to thrill Aussie fans with their Honda CRF450RWE bikes. Extra services will help you get to and from Marvel Stadium on Saturday 30 November 2024.
The gates open at 5.00pm.
